title: Data used to build algorithms detecting skin disease is too white
writtenTitle: Data used to build algorithms detecting skin disease is too white
summary:
Public skin image datasets that are used to train algorithms to detect skin problems don’t include enough info about skin tone.
Of the images with skin tone info (2,236), only 11 were from patients with the darkest two categories on the Fitzpatrick scale.
The lack of data limits researchers’ ability to spot biases in algorithms trained on the images.
